00027 /* 
00028  * PROTOTYPES should be set to one if and only if the 
00029  * compiler supports function argument prototyping.
00030 
00031  * The following makes PROTOTYPES default to 0 if 
00032  * it has not already
00033  */
00034 
00035 
00036 #ifndef PROTOTYPES
00037 
00038 #define PROTOTYPES 0
00039 
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 /* POINTER defines a generic pointer type */
00043 
00044 typedef unsigned char *POINTER;
00045 
00046 /* UINT2 defines a two byte word */
00047 
00048 typedef unsigned short int UINT2;
00049 
00050 /* UINT4 defines a four byte word */
00051 
00052 typedef unsigned long int UINT4;
00053 
00054 /* PROTO_LIST is defined depending on how PROTOTYPES is defined above.
00055 
00056 If using PROTOTYPES, then PROTO_LIST returns the list, otherwise it
00057 returns an empty list. 
00058  */
00059 
00060 #if PROTOTYPES
00061 
00062 #define PROTO_LIST(list) list
00063 
00064 #else
00065 
00066 #define PROTO_LIST(list) ()
00067 
00068 #endif
00069
